Apple Cake. Thanks to my sister-in-law
Victoria, this is a delicious, simple yet

rustic dessert. I've already peeled and

an inch thick. They're soaking in a bowl
of ice water and the juice of half a

lemon. We'll just set this aside
until we're ready to use them. To prepare

your 8 inch cake pan for the cake, I'm
going to show you what my mom taught me.

Just a napkin with some Crisco
shortening and you'll rub it all around

the pan, on the sides covering the entire
surface. This will help or this will

prevent your cake from sticking to the
pan so it comes out easily. Some people

line the bottom and the sides with
parchment. This one is fine without the

parchment paper. Okay
sprinkle in a little bit of flour

all-purpose flour. And now you're just
going to rotate this on the bottom and

then on the sides you can do this back
into your container of flour or into

another container. And there you go, a
nicely coated pan. In the bowl I have 5

half a cup of sugar. Room-temperature
eggs, beat this well.
